metadata.synopsis: Karlach has an approval rating higher or equal than 30 and she decides to ask for an avatar to have a relationship with her.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Have an approval rating of 30 with her and go to camp or use the debug book to force the night.

41.speaker: Karlach
41.text: Psst! Hey soldier - you aren't asleep, are you?
41.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player is lying on their bedroll - Karlach leaning over [LOGAN] Karlach approaches from PLYR's left side. NodeContext: [LOGAN] Re-record note: Karlach starts by whispering as they wake the PLYR up in middle of the night, and then goes into normal speaking voice.

60.speaker: Karlach
60.text: I'm buzzing, honestly. I couldn't wait to talk to you.
60.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player sits up, Karlach sits in front of them. [LOGAN] Karlach goes from leaning over PLYR, to sitting down in casual pose -- check with Greg for ref. image.

74.speaker: Karlach
74.text: Heya soldier - I think everyone's asleep. May I?
74.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player is lying on their bedroll - Karlach leaning over.  [LOGAN] Karlach approaches from PLYR's left side. NodeContext: [LOGAN] Re-record note: Karlach starts by whispering as they wake the PLYR up in middle of the night, and then goes into normal speaking voice.

55.speaker: Karlach
55.text: Hello, you. I've been waiting for this all night.
55.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player sits up, Karlach sits in front of them. [LOGAN] Karlach goes from leaning over PLYR, to sitting down in casual pose -- check with Greg for ref. image.

94.speaker: Karlach
94.text: Isn't it mad? How good life is?

83.speaker: Player
83.text: I know what you mean. When I look at you, it's all I can think about.

43.speaker: Karlach
43.text: Thank the gods. I was afraid I was the only one. Ten years is a long time to be trapped in the Hells. Ten years without a kind word, a touch.
43.context: NodeContext: She reaches her hand out as though to touch you, but stops short.

53.speaker: Karlach
53.text: When I look at you, I feel real again. Alive. Gods, I want to ride you 'til you see stars.

12.speaker: Player
12.text: You don't have to ask me twice. Let's go.

66.speaker: Player
66.text: You don't mince words, do you?

15.speaker: Karlach
15.text: Guess not. I just feel what I feel. No sense hiding it.

10.speaker: Player
10.text: Karlach, I like you, but we hardly know each other.

69.speaker: Karlach
69.text: Not true! I know you're a goblin-destroyer, an adventurer, and most importantly, I know you like me.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: All true, but there's more than that. Or have you forgotten the fine art of conversation?

103.speaker: Karlach
103.text: Honey, when I look at you, my brain turns to mush.

81.speaker: Player
81.text: You do seem to have the relevant parts of me in hand.

84.speaker: Karlach
84.text: Oh, now you're just teasing me. Evil.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: Evil would be grabbing you and kissing you with no regard for the consequences.

91.speaker: Player
91.text: We need to find a solution to the 'infernal engine' problem before we get any closer.

44.speaker: Player
44.text: Then let me backtrack and take you up on your first offer. Something about seeing stars?

33.speaker: Karlach
33.text: Ugh, I'm sorry - I shouldn't tease you - or myself. I'd give anything to touch you, but I can't. Not until I can be sure I won't burn you.

2.speaker: Karlach
2.text: I'll turn you to charcoal. Guaranteed.
2.context: NodeContext: She wants to but REALLY doesn't want to hurt you

97.speaker: Player
97.text: The flames get worse when you're excited, right? What if we cool you down?

25.speaker: Karlach
25.text: Around you? Tall order. But if you've got an idea, I'm all ears.

35.speaker: Player
35.text: Let's try breathing deeply, in and out.

3.speaker: Karlach
3.text: In and out, you say? I'd never considered that. But I think I know what you mean. I'll give it a go.
3.context: CinematicNodeContext: She begins to flame, but it then dies downNodeContext: Karlach closes her eyes and breaths in and out slowly, calming herself.

26.speaker: Karlach
26.text: Ugh, I'm terrible at this. What should we do now?

39.speaker: Player
39.text: I know some magic that might help me handle your fire. Let me see...

92.speaker: Karlach
92.text: Sleep on it, maybe. If you've thought of something by morning, I'd love to know. For now, it's enough just to know you care enough to try.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: We'll make it quick. One tiny kiss, nothing more.

71.speaker: Karlach
71.text: We can try. But don't hurt those pretty lips of yours, all right? They feature heavily in my future plans.
71.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player and Karlach lean in for a kiss. Their lips touch, and Karlach immediately stars flaming. [LOGAN] V.O Can be delivered up to leaning into kiss, don't need to act going to kiss.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: Kiss her more deeply. Your passion is hotter than her flames.

89.speaker: Karlach
89.context: CinematicNodeContext: Karlach starts to get lost in the kiss, then abruptly opens her eyes and pushes the player away. Player takes fire damage.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: A little singed, but it was worth it.

73.speaker: Karlach
73.text: You have no idea. If I weren't so worried about killing you, I'd be in a puddle on the floor.

105.speaker: Player
105.text: No! You nearly burnt my face off!

82.speaker: Karlach
82.text: I told you, I'm an 'at your own risk' attraction. Make better decisions.

72.speaker: Karlach
72.text: You can't make me be the responsible one. I'll destroy us both.

98.speaker: Karlach
98.text: So what do we do now?

51.speaker: Karlach
51.text: Haven't read a book since I was a kid. Not a lot of exciting fiction in Avernus. Tell you what, you find one you think I should read, and I'll check it out.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: Let's talk. I still know so little about you.

21.speaker: Karlach
21.text: Please. My life is an instant mood-killer, and I'm enjoying this mood. Maybe even a little too much.

49.speaker: Karlach
49.text: I'd better head back to my bunk. You might not be able to touch me, but you've given me a lot to... think about.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: Maybe I can't touch you, but I could tell you what I'd like to do with you...

48.speaker: Karlach
48.text: I like the sound of that.
48.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player leans in and whispers something in Karlach's ear. She smiles - player is telling her R-rated things.

90.speaker: Karlach
90.context: CinematicNodeContext: Karlach leans and whispers in the player's ear. Player smiles and laughs in return.

93.speaker: Karlach
93.text: I like the sound of that.
93.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player leans in and whispers something in Karlach's ear. She smiles - player is telling her R-rated things.

30.speaker: Karlach
30.context: CinematicNodeContext: Karlach leans and whispers in the player's ear. Player smiles and laughs in return.

47.speaker: Karlach
47.text: On that note, I'd better head back to my bunk. You might not be able to touch me, but you've given me a lot to... think about.

99.speaker: Karlach
99.context: CinematicNodeContext: Karlach starts to get lost in the kiss, then abruptly opens her eyes and pushes the player away. Player takes fire damage.

75.speaker: Karlach
75.text: The best worst decision. So what do we do now?
75.context: NodeContext: With regret. She wants to kiss you badly.

64.speaker: Player
64.text: This is going a little fast - let's slow down.

16.speaker: Karlach
16.text: We can try. But don't hurt those pretty lips of yours, all right? They feature heavily in my future plans.
16.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player and Karlach lean in for a kiss. Their lips touch, and Karlach immediately stars flaming. [LOGAN] V.O Can be delivered up to leaning into kiss, don't need to act going to kiss.

79.speaker: Karlach
79.text: Don't tempt me. It isn't fair.

19.speaker: Player
19.text: Maybe we should keep our distance, then.

56.speaker: Player
56.text: We need to find a solution to the 'infernal engine' problem first.

17.speaker: Karlach
17.text: I know. What I want and what I can have are two very different things.

67.speaker: Karlach
67.text: I'm just... ngh... combustible. Ten years is a long time without anyone's touch but my own. And when I look at you, I just feel... explosive.

86.speaker: Player
86.text: Sorry, but I'm not interested in you in that way.

37.speaker: Karlach
37.text: Sorry if I was a little forward. Ten years in Avernus and I guess I've forgotten whatever manners I might've had.

106.speaker: Karlach
106.text: Don't hold it against me. Unless you want to.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: I admire your optimism, but is it that good?

62.speaker: Karlach
62.text: Yes! Soldier, you're saving me. Every time you speak my name, fight beside me, share what's yours, I'm reminded that I'm alive. Properly alive. And free.

5.speaker: Karlach
5.text: Ugh, GODS, I want to ride you 'til you see stars.

45.speaker: Karlach
45.text: Ah come on, don't give me that. We're here, we're alive, we're together.

68.speaker: Karlach
68.text: I never made peace with my life in Avernus. Ten years, and I never accepted that that was what my life would be.

54.speaker: Karlach
54.text: I held my own against the devils and imps, but they weren't my friends. How could they be? You don't go to the Hells to live. You go to punish and be punished.

65.speaker: Karlach
65.text: I'm free now. Incredible, isn't it? And I can have whatever I want.

9.speaker: Karlach
9.text: And right now I want to ride you 'til you see stars.
